hypothesis: Larger CMA-ES population sizes improve covariance estimation and convergence quality in inverse problems.

tuning_runs.finding: Popsize=12 is WORSE: -0.0022 score, +14.6 min vs W2 baseline

best_overall.note: OVER BUDGET, WORSE than baseline. Experiment aborted after run 1.

baseline_to_beat.config: 40% temporal + 8 NM polish (W2 best, default popsize ~6/~8)

conclusion: FAILED - Larger population size adds time without improving accuracy. Default popsize is already optimal.
key_findings: Popsize=12 adds ~14 min (73 vs 58.4) without improving score
Default CMA-ES popsize (~6 for 1-src, ~8 for 2-src) is sufficient
Each generation with larger population costs more simulations
With fixed feval budget, larger popsize = fewer generations
CMA-ES covariance adaptation works fine with default popsize for this problem dimension
